intro: Kuhlhasseltia integra, commonly known as the white-flowered kuhlhasseltia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spineless stems and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
